assess.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make a judgment about a person or situation after thinking carefully about it
assess.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: a report to assess the impact of advertising on children
assess the impact/extent/effectiveness etc of something
The technique is being tried in classrooms to assess what effects it may have.
Many of the adults were assessed as having learning difficulties.
assess.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to calculate the value or cost of something
assess.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The value of the business was assessed at £1.25 million.
assess.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make a judgement about a person or situation after considering all the information
assess.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: This information is needed to assess efficiency and effectiveness.
The federal government assessed that the assets had been acquired illegally.
assess.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to calculate how much something will cost to repair, how much something is worth, how much money someone should be given etc
assess.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: Ten loss adjusters are still assessing the extent of the damage.
The net value of his estate was assessed at around £6,250,000.
assess.translation[1].definitions[2].def: to calculate the amount of tax someone should pay
assess.translation[1].definitions[2].exa: The payroll tax isn’t assessed on wages above a certain level.
